title: Riot, Will Syndra see some love in the mage update ?
body: She is pretty immobile ... You guys planned on giving her a new passive and all, but the changes never went through...

replies.body: Syndra is a VERY strong candidate for a smaller Twitch/Lucian level update
Was it like with Twitch's Q getting reset and Luc's Culling changes?

Yup! 

When we do these class updates we look at the class as a whole. We will be doing changes to many champions but the "big 6" just had changes big enough to require art/animation changes as well.
Sometimes I wonder did you called yourself "Reav3" because someone took the original "Reav" shame on them!

Syndra could be in the "big 7" X)
I teased you sorry
I think if her passive was updated to have a use before she fully maxed an ability or she was given some kind of safety like a haste she'd be fine...  Maybe buff her early game q damage a bit.

She has plenty of potential, but also a very one-trick pony kind of playstyle.

Would love to see some neat things like having her fully-leveled Q drag people closer to it (ie mini Diana E/Viktor W); She IS a gravity mage, after all.
She just needs her fantasy stressed a little more.  Nothing about her kit really screams "gravity/force", other than what her spells look like.
Could turn her spells into rocks and easily say "Yup, this is a boulder mage", with no real difference.
Shes not actually a gravity mage, shes more of a conpressed matter mage. at least thats how i have always seen it, she compresses matter into a solid state and uses that to her own whim.

My question though: Does this matter?

_*Badum-ts_

Compressed energy, you mean? 
>compresses matter into a solid state

makes no sense otherwise

>Compressed energy, you mean?

You can compress other states of matter into a solid state. Heavily increasing the pressure on a liquid, gas or theoretically even a plasma (although the energy required to do so would be absurd) will force it into a solid state.

Compression of energy doesn't really make sense because the form of energy that can theoretically be compressed into matter is light, which is clearly not what she's using.

I think if you want to use compression as an explanation compression of matter into a singularity (which is what I think Elewd meant anyway) is the best.
Earthbender Syndra confirmed.
Any rough estimate of when we'll see some mage changes on the PBE? And serious question, is anything going to be done about the terrible AP itemization and their absurd costs?

I'm not sure what the final result of the costs will be, but the systems group will be adding and tweaking existing Mage items for the update. It won't be a as huge as the Marksmen Item update though.
Either way it's good to know that at least they're being looked at. Thank you.

Has any thought been given to reworking her ult?

I've always been annoyed at how Syndra's ult doesn't really live up to what her kit's supposed to be. She's got these cool abilities built around manipulating her spheres, and then her ult has nothing to do with how she positions them and is just a massive nuke.

I'd love to see her with an ultimate that actually cares about her sphere's positioning, since that's kind of what her kit's about.

Her current ult feels like it doesn't fit in with what her kit should be about. Imagine if Orianna's ult was just ground targeted instead of targeting around her ball. That's how Syndra's ult feels in context of the rest of her kit.

about a year ago i had an idea that her ult would merge all her active spheres in front of her and create a black hole moving forward in front of her, and it would 'suck in' (dunno how to implement that mechanic) minions and champions (the more spheres you merge, the bigger the singularity) and explode at the end of it's trajectory, dealing damage based on how many spheres+enemies were in it

p.s. By 'suck in' i mean that you are slowed and dragged towards the center of it, you can escape it if you're at the edge, but if you get dragged into the center you are 'absorbed' and become untargettable as you are carried to the end of the trajectory and take the explosion's damage

and now aurelion sol's Q looks alot like that old idea i had XD

I still stand by my original statement that She should be given cassiopeia's %ap passive thing but apply it to when syndra maxes a skill t get the bonus effect + like 5% bonus ap. so you get 20% naturally scaling in the game because i view her as the ultimate threat once she hits level 16

I don't think Syndra should get some %ap nor cdr passiv thing like Cassiopea, honestly, it might be a good passive on Syndra but on Cassio it's kinda unoticable, why wouldn't be the same for our lovely Dark Soverign ?

Syndra's whole fantasy is to max your skill and get an insane burst of more damage, right now that only applies to her Q, the other 2 abilities don't give that same feeling when they are maxed that she got stronger. Giving her 5% bonus ap per skill maxed (so 20% at level 18) she gets a huge burst of more damage, this causes her midgame-lategame to become incredibly strong as she continues to scale. I dont think she should get cdr, i just want her to get the %ap boost, Syndra's passive is lackluster at the moment and this small change should help fill the gap and turn her into the ultimate "fear my level 9 power spike"

She either needs better teamfighting damage, or some form of better utility.

I tend to beat champions like Akali until they string the game along and try to snowball off other people's deaths...but honestly, after I E-stun her, unless I have enough health to survive her burst or just delete her so she can't do anything, it doesn't matter. Similar to Diana. If I can't interrupt her ult dash, probably dead unless I can kite her accordingly. Instead of changing the mini damage buffs skills you get at 5, you can make them scale up per level and/or add to the passive in a way or give a mobility-esque passive to an ability. Idk, something. Diana treatment of making her orbs hit faster so portions of it can't be blocked? If I combo someone and if I R last, they might actually get to a safe vantage point or get protection as the final ball or balls hit (Braum?).

>I tend to beat champions like Akali until they string the game along and try to snowball off other people's deaths...but honestly, after I E-stun her, unless I have enough health to survive her burst or just delete her so she can't do anything

Syndra's kit is a perfect counter to assassin Akali's. I play both champs and have played this matchup from both sides and I can honestly say that if the Syndra's competent it becomes borderline impossible for Akali to lane against her. I legit used to consider this the single worst lane matchup in the game, I think it's a little better for Akali since Syndra's ~~gutting~~ nerfs but it's still pretty bad.

Diana's probably about the same since they're super similar, I think she fairs a little better thanks to her poke and shield though. Basically I think if Syndra was having trouble in these matchups it would show serious problems in her power level.
Put Syndra side by side with veigar's kit and you will realize there is no reason to pick her
